meanings.definition: Obtain by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He tried to finagle his way out of doing his chores by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: She managed to finagle a free ticket to the concert by sweet-talking the security guard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat finagled its way into the pantry and stole some treats.
meanings.sent4: The clever fox finagled the henhouse door open and snuck inside.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky raccoon finagled the lid off the garbage can to get to the leftovers.

meanings.definition: To obtain by trickery or deception.
meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to finagle money from unsuspecting victims with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to finagle her way out of trouble with her smooth talking.
meanings.sent3: The magician finagled the audience into believing he could make a rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: The sly thief finagled the safe open with his expert lock-picking skills.
meanings.sent5: The cunning spy finagled the secret documents from the enemy's headquarters.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or maneuver in a skillful or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The skilled negotiator finagled a better deal for his client by playing hardball.
meanings.sent2: She always finds a way to finagle her schedule to fit in all her activities.
meanings.sent3: The crafty squirrel finagled the bird feeder to get to the seeds inside.
meanings.sent4: The cunning general finagled his troops into position without the enemy noticing.
meanings.sent5: The clever inventor finagled the machine to work faster with a simple adjustment.
